Class Database

  • java.lang.Object
    • Database

  • public class Database
extends java.lang.Object
    Class Database contains all of the necessary methods to save game stats into a database. It can create a table, insert data into a table, delete data from a table, and read data from a table.
    Author:
    Meghan Rogers, Nick Chua, Ewan Akins
    See Also:
    "No Borrowed Code"

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      (package private) static java.lang.String COLOR
      The label for the color column in the database.
      (package private) java.sql.Connection connection
      An object of class Connection that allows us to connect to the database.

      The connection URL.
      (package private) static java.lang.String DATABASE_NAME
      The name given to the database.

      The name of our table.

      The label for the primary key.
      (package private) static java.lang.String LOSSES
      The label for the losses column in the database

      The label for the name column in the database.
      (package private) static java.lang.String WINS
      The label for the wins column in the database.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Database()
      The constructor gets the connection to the database and then calls createStatsTable().

    • Constructor Detail

      • Database

        public Database()
        The constructor gets the connection to the database and then calls createStatsTable().

    • Method Detail

      • createStatsTable

        public void createStatsTable()
        Creates a table that holds game stats. The stats include player wins/losses as well as player colors and symbols.

      • insertStats

        public void insertStats(GameStats gameStats)
        Inserts specific game stats into the database.
        Parameters:
        gameStats - the game stats that are to be saved

      • getAllGameStatsList

        public java.util.List<GameStats> getAllGameStatsList()
        Reads all of the game stats from the database.
        Returns:
        ArrayList statsList, a list of the game stats from the database

      • deleteAllStats

        public void deleteAllStats()
        Deletes the game stats from the database table.

      • getConnection

        public void getConnection()
        Obtains a connection to the database via the connection url.

      • closeConnection

        public void closeConnection()
        Closes the connection to the database.

      • tableExists

        private boolean tableExists()
        Checks for the existence of a database table.
        Returns:
        boolean hasNext, true if the table already exists, false otherwise
